document.masterDocTitle: The presence of Notanisus Walker (Hymenoptera: Pteromalidae) in North America and revision of the oulmesiensis species group

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The presence of Notanisus Walker (Hymenoptera: Pteromalidae) in North America and revision of the oulmesiensis species group

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURES 37 – 45. Notanisus longipetiolus ♀. 37 – 41, holotype: 37, lateral habitus; 38, pronotum and mesonotum, dorsolateral; 39, head and pronotum; 40, scutellar-axillar complex; 41; mesepimeron and metapleuron. 42, propodeum – base of gaster and metacoxae, dorsal (2014 - 45). 43 – 45, holotype: 43, antenna, lateral; 44, fore wing; 45, fore wing apex (dashed lines delimit dorsal bare region).
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURES 46 – 52. Notanisus longipetiolus ♂. 46, lateral habitus (2014 - 37). 47, dorsal habitus (2014 - 38). 48, head and pronotum, frontolateral (2014 - 38). 49, antenna, lateral (2014 - 46). 50, fore wing (2014 - 46). 51, propodeum – base of gaster and metacoxae, dorsal (2014 - 38). 52, mesepimeron – petiole and metacoxa, lateral (2014 - 37).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material
. Holotype ♀ ( CNC ). MOZAMBIQUE : Niassa Prov., Cuamba, Mituque,
7–26 .ix. 2008
, N. Olmi, MT [point-mounted; entire, but gaster unnaturally inflated due to critical point drying].

Paratypes .
MOZAMBIQUE
. Niassa, Cuamba, Catholic University of Mozambique , farm,
4 .II– 4 .III. 2005
, 600 m, M. Olmi (
2 ♂
CNC ).
ZIMBABWE
. Rhodesia , Salisbury, A. Watsham ( 1 ♀,
6 ♂
NMPC [

also with “
IX. 1978
”]). Rhodesia , Chishawasha Nr. Salisbury /
XII. 1978
, A. Watsham ( 1 ♀,
2 ♂
NMPC ).
Etymology . Formed from the Latin words longus (long) and petiolus (stalk) in reference to its comparatively long petiole.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 37–45.
Notanisus longipetiolus
♀. 37–41, holotype: 37, lateral habitus; 38, pronotum and mesonotum, dorsolateral; 39, head and pronotum; 40, scutellar-axillar complex; 41; mesepimeron and metapleuron. 42, propodeum–base of gaster and metacoxae, dorsal (2014-45). 43–45, holotype: 43, antenna, lateral; 44, fore wing; 45, fore wing apex (dashed lines delimit dorsal bare region).

FIGURES 46–52.
Notanisus longipetiolus
♂. 46, lateral habitus (2014-37). 47, dorsal habitus (2014-38). 48, head and pronotum, frontolateral (2014-38). 49, antenna, lateral (2014-46). 50, fore wing (2014-46). 51, propodeum–base of gaster and metacoxae, dorsal (2014-38). 52, mesepimeron–petiole and metacoxa, lateral (2014-37).
